intro: Athanasia quinquedentata subsp. rigens, commonly known as the rigid five-toothed dandelion, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow composite flowers that develop into elongated, spiny seed heads. The plant has a taproot system and is adapted to arid and rocky environments. It is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. The subspecies is distinguished by its more rigid stem and leaf structure compared to other subspecies of Athanasia quinquedentata.
